page.title: 14TOURISM IN PORLOCK
page.content: Porlock is a picturesque village edging the Exmoor hills by the sea. Its attractions include walking,riding fishing and generally 'get away from it all' facilities.There is a pebble beach,keeping away commercial interests and companies.Tourism is now the basis of Porlock's economy saving it from serious{financial {problems.}Tourist information and a museum are run by local volunteers who provide a{free newspaper.}The price of a holiday is slowly going up mainly because of inflation.This is not really a place that young couples come to unless their children are on holiday and then they mainly go to one of the two{caravan sites.}Porlock has lost large numbers of tourists since the direct Taunton to Minehead{railway {line}was{cut}in the seventies.
